item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Djayawarman Alamprabu
item.description: "I don't believe in information, I believe in disinformation." -- Djayawarman Alamprabu

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Djayawarman Alamprabu
item.description: "An Idea is nothing but Information, It won't do us any harm until we accept it as perception of truth in our mind, which in time will potentially evolve and construct major events in history." -- Djayawarman Alamprabu

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Imam Ja'Far Al-Sadiq
item.description: "Verily, knowledge is a lock and its key is the question." -- Imam Ja'Far Al-Sadiq

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "It's not radical Islam that worries the US -- it's independence" -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "Education is a system of imposed ignorance." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "...the Bible is probably the most genocidal book in the literary canon." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by John Pilger
item.description: "The U.S. is a cosmetic democracy." -- John Pilger

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by John Pilger
item.description: "It is not enough for journalists to see themselves as mere messengers without understanding the hidden agendas of the message and the myths that surround it." -- John Pilger

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Archbishop Oscar Romero
item.description: "To educate is to create a critical spirit and not just transfer knowledge" -- Archbishop Oscar Romero

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "All over the place, from the popular culture to the propaganda system, there is constant pressure to make people feel that they are helpless, that the only role they can have is to ratify decisions and to consume." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "Either you repeat the same conventional doctrines everybody is saying, or else you say something true, and it will sound like it's from Neptune." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "No man ever believes that the Bible means what it says: He is always convinced that it says what he means." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Sujiwo Tejo
item.description: "Kekasihku jangan bersedih tidurlah dan bermimpi, kenegeri kehamparan, kehampaan.. Kasih, Kenegeri Kehamparan, Kehampaan.. Tawa canda. Dan Biar kelak anak-anak mu kan percaya bualan Mu, jangan kau bersedih.....Pada Sebuah Ranjang" -- Sujiwo Tejo

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Sujiwo Tejo
item.description: "Wong takon wosing dur angkoro.. Antarane riko aku iki--Titi Kolo Mongso" -- Sujiwo Tejo

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Sujiwo Tejo
item.description: "Pada kancah Baratayuda Pada kancah perang besarmu hari ini Bisma, jiwa besar pada sekeping kaca Setiap saat Engkau berkaca Gugur --Gugur Bhisma--" -- Sujiwo Tejo

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Alphonse de Lamartine
item.description: "If greatness of purpose, smallness of means, and astonishing results are the three criteria of a human genius, who could dare compare any great man in history with Muhammad?" -- Alphonse de Lamartine

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by R. Bosworth Smith
item.description: "He was Caesar and Pope in one; but he was Pope without Pope's pretensions, Caesar without the legions of Caesar: without a standing army, without a bodyguard, without a palace, without a fixed revenue; if ever any man had the right to say that he ruled by the right divine, it was Mohammed, for he had all the power without its instruments and without its supports. He cared not for the dressings of power. The simplicity of his private life was in keeping with his public life." " -- R. Bosworth Smith

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Michael H. Hart
item.description: "My choice of Muhammad to lead the list of the world's most influential persons may surprise some readers and may be questioned by others, but he was the only man in history who was supremely successful on both the religious and secular level." -- Michael H. Hart

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Hiroya Oku
item.description: "There comes a time when we can no longer tell the invaders from the invaded. That is what we call "War." -- Hiroya Oku

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Hiroya Oku
item.description: "I end up saving the world, just to save you" -- Hiroya Oku

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Hiroya Oku
item.description: "The Killer instinct is not perceived by words, but by look." -- Hiroya Oku

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Hiroya Oku
item.description: "Despair... It hides away propagates, expands, and finally explodes" -- Hiroya Oku

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Hiroya Oku
item.description: "Fear beyond rational limits forces people to cling to normality" -- Hiroya Oku

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "All great truths begin as blasphemies." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "The lies (Western slander) which well-meaning zeal has heaped round this man (Muhammad) are disgraceful to ourselves only." -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Alphonse de Lamartine
item.description: "Philosopher, orator, apostle, legislator, warrior, conqueror of ideas, restorer of rational dogmas, of a cult without images, the founder of twenty terrestrial empires and of one spiritual empire: that is MUHAMMAD. As regards all the standards by which human greatness may be measured, we may well ask IS THERE ANY MAN GREATER THAN HE?" -- Alphonse de Lamartine

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I become more than ever convinced that it was not the sword that won a place for Islam in those days. It was the rigid simplicity, the utter self-effacement of Hussein, the scrupulous regard for pledges, his intense devotion to his friends and followers and his intrepidity, his fearlessness, his absolute trust in God and in his own mission. These and not the sword carried everything before them and surmounted every obstacle." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by William Montgomery Watt
item.description: "His readiness to undergo persecutions for his beliefs, the high moral character of the men who believed in him and looked up to him as leader, and the greatness of his ultimate achievement - all argue his fundamental integrity. To suppose Muhammad an impostor raises more problems than it solves. Moreover, none of the great figures of history is so poorly appreciated in the West as Muhammad" -- William Montgomery Watt

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Muhammad has always been standing higher than the Christianity. He does not consider god as a human being and never makes himself equal to God. Muslims worship nothing except God and Muhammad is his Messenger. There is no any mystery and secret in it." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Djayawarman add a quote by Helen Thomas
item.description: "Q: What do Jesus and Nicole Brown Simpson have in common? A: They were both killed by the Joooooooose." -- Helen Thomas
